I hate all AntiD's, OK?  I despise them all.   I'm an ex druggie (long time ago from the 70s).  AntiD's (when the doc began prescribing them for me in the late 90's - I guess I tried about 6 of them in three years time)  made me feel like I needed a bag or had just shot some Thunderbird.  From Paxil to Celexa to Prozac to Lexapro to Zoloft to....(few others, probably) nothing worked, and I believe they probably also helped speed some liver damage along.   I'll believe it til the day I die and will tell others, too, that AntiD's for some just ain't gonna work and will make you feel worse - a lot worse.   Wellbutrin?  lol - that is one I have not tried and was wondering a few months ago if I should try it because it at least has the "speed" demon recipe in it from what I hear  (not like the elephant tranquilizer Lexapro was for me).   Wellbutrin might be making you feel worse, ya know?I still say - you gotta force yourself to GET OUT.  I am anti-psychiatrist, too,  OK?    Well, not really - just kidding there  (I go to one --lol, and I love her)  but I know this much, and that is - you cannot get well just sitting in a shrink's office and taking AntiD's, and that's all there is to it.  Make sure a doc has ruled out the common things that might be wrong with you, like anemia, thyroid disease, diabetes, and then - if all is well there, you gotta get out in addition to seeing the shrink and taking AntiD's!  Hang in there.
